articles.title: Inside the breach that broke the internet: The untold story of Log4Shell
articles.description: Log4Shell proved that open source security isn't guaranteed and isn‚Äôt just a code problem. It's about supporting, enabling, and empowering the people behind the projects that build our digital infrastructure. The post Inside the breach that broke the internet: The untold story of Log4Shell appeared
articles.content: When Christian Grobmeier went to help his son with a Minecraft problem, he found the game displaying a warning: “We are suffering from a security hole from Log4J, please be careful and update immediately.” I stared at the screen and told my son, ‘I’m sorry, it’s my fault.’ Christian Grobmeier, Log4j maintainer This is the untold story of how one maintainer and the Log4j team navigated a crisis that exposed critical gaps in our digital infrastructure and demons
articles.author: Gregg Cochran

articles.title: Beyond Prompts: Are AI Agents Like Auto-GPT the Future of Software Development?
articles.description: We've all been playing with LLMs, crafting clever prompts to generate code snippets, debug errors, or write documentation. But what if your AI could do more than just respond to a prompt? What if it could think, plan, and execute multi-step tasks autonomously? Welcome to the world of AI Agents, spea
articles.content: We've all been playing with LLMs, crafting clever prompts to generate code snippets, debug errors, or write documentation. But what if your AI could do more than just respond to a prompt? What if it could think, plan, and execute multi-step tasks autonomously? Welcome to the world of AI Agents, spearheaded by projects like Auto-GPT. These agents aren't just intelligent chatbots; they're designed to set their own goals, break them down into sub-tasks, use tools (like web browsers or code interpre
articles.author: The Deep-Fried Dev

articles.content: It‚Äôs late August in Rwanda‚Äôs capital, Kigali, and people are filling a large hall at one of Africa‚Äôs biggest gatherings of minds in AI and machine learning. A classic East African folk song by the Tanzanian singer Saida Karoli plays loudly on the speakers. Friends greet each other as waiters serve arrowroot crisps and sugary mocktails. articles.content: Kin Lane fondly remembers working on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid in 2013. FAFSA is used by millions of college students each year to help access scholarship money, and Lane, an API expert, had an up-close look at the system. He saw the importance of ensuring financial data remains stored securely and can be accessed by Internal Revenue Service tools. The job wasn't flashy, but it was tangibly meaningful - when his own daughter went to college, he would use FAFSA himself. Lane wa
articles.author: Lauren Feiner

articles.content: Maintaining your project’s community health files shouldn’t get in the way of writing code. articles.content: Meta is planning to axe around 600 roles within its legacy AI research division, according to a report from Axios . The layoffs will reportedly impact Meta‚Äôs Fundamental AI Research unit, also known as FAIR, along with its AI product and infrastructure division, while the company continues to hire workers for its newly formed superintelligence team, TBD Lab.
